file_content.text: I... I do not think I will be filing any more reports....
We'll get you to a kolto tank.
Hang on, Miel.
It is too late for that.
Why didn't you let me handle those Imperials myself?
You should've stayed away.
It was my duty as a member of the Sullustan Constable Brigade to apprehend the lawbreakers.
Don't bleed all over me, all right?
Ugh--you're a mess.
My service to the people of Sullust ends today.
I am unable to maintain pursuit of Skavak. You must go on without me. I have something that will help you.
Poor little guy. He didn't deserve to go out like this.
Find Skavak. Bring him to justice... for me....
I will find a way out of this place, with or without you!
Upstanding citizen? Hello! Over here! Help me!
I take it you met the Justicars.
Miel? You're in jail?
They are lawbreakers pretending to be peace officers. That is a severe offense under Statute 52974 of the Sullustan Criminal Code.
How do you know my name?
Do I know you?
It is Officer Miel Muwn of the Sullustan Constable Brigade. We subdued lawbreakers at the spaceport, remember?
Stand still, I want to get a holo of this.
Oh, this is priceless.
Please, do not add to my embarrassment by creating a permanent record of this incident.
The fugitive Skavak ambushed me down here and fled. The Justicars interrupted my pursuit and demanded I surrender.
Did you at least manage to wound him?
You fought Skavak?
Skavak and I exchanged fire without incident, unfortunately.
You were supposed to contact me when you found Skavak.
Why didn't you call?
I would have, but my holotransmitter was destroyed during Skavak's ambush.
Skavak stole my ship. Which way did he go?
I need to find your fugitive.
Aha! I knew you were not being truthful back at the spaceport! Unfortunately, I lost sight of Skavak when the Justicars arrived.
You should've ignored those Justicars and kept going.
Why did you obey?
I must yield to local constables when I am out of my jurisdiction.
I did not want to harm people who I believed were local authorities, so I surrendered and allowed the Justicars to bring me here.
The Justicars are a bunch of crazy vigilantes.
That was a bad idea.
I became aware of my error when they put me in a cell.
Have they hurt you?
You look a little beat up.
Luckily, they forgot about me when they brought a male human in for interrogation.
You idiot.
I was attempting to cooperate with fellow peace officers. It was an honest mistake.
Might as well spring the little fella while we're here.
Skavak is getting away, upstanding citizen. I need you to release me from this cell immediately.
Don't worry, I won't leave you in there.
You got it.
Fine, but stay out of my way.
This is the second time you have come to my aid. I owe you a significant debt.
I must re-arm and renew my pursuit of Skavak. Thank you for your help, upstanding citizen.
Get out of here before the Justicars come back.
Don't mention it.
I'm really not an upstanding citizen.
Stop calling me that.
You are too modest. Of everyone I have encountered on Coruscant, you are by far the most upstanding.
When I return to Sullust, I will file a Form 453391 and request an official commendation for your actions today.
I'm only freeing you because I hate seeing morons behind bars.
Have fun, dummy.
You are the least pleasant upstanding citizen I have ever met.
I like you better this way. Have fun!
Not a chance.
I must revise my assessment of you in my reports. You are no upstanding citizen at all, are you?
This is me, upstanding away from you....
I'm very upstanding.
Got it one.
What are you planning to write that report on? Your shirt?
Go ahead and file your report.
I will find a way out of this place, with or without you!
Upstanding citizen? Hello! Over here! Help me!
I must wait for the local security forces to arrive. Their response time leaves much to be desired.
I am sorry you were forced to fight. I know you would have preferred a more peaceful resolution for yourself, upstanding citizen.
I'm not really what you'd call an "upstanding citizen."
Don't call me that.
If I have offended you, I am sorry. My ship's cultural databanks are not as current as they could be.
You don't seem too broken up about killing those men.
You preferred to shoot.
A good law officer does what is necessary at all times and files a full report. Those lawbreakers should have surrendered.
Those idiots shouldn't have messed with me.
They deserved death.
I would have preferred to arrest them. Lethal force is always a last resort. Now, I have many datapads to fill out.
You performed extremely well in the line of duty, deputy. You have more than earned your salary allowance this day.
I only accept Republic credits, got it?
Pay up.
I exchanged currency when I first arrived on this planet. You will be rewarded using the appropriate credits.
You'd be a smoking heap if I hadn't come along.
I sure did.
Indigo-rating investigators like myself are not so easy to kill, but you could not have known that.
I don't need praise from you.
Save the speeches.
I understand. You performed your duty without desire for personal recognition.
I am grateful for your assistance, deputy. I apologize for drafting you into service on short notice, but you performed admirably.
I just wanted to shoot those guys, all right?
You didn't draft me.
Regardless, you have my thanks. I will make special note of your heroism in my full report.
Sticking up for the little guy is what I do best.
Not a problem.
I am considered tall for a Sullustan. My species averages one point five meters in height, but I have achieved one point six meters.
I'm not your deputy anymore, get me?
I don't work for you.
Understood. Now that the immediate danger has passed, you may return to being an upstanding citizen.
I have not properly identified myself to you. I am Officer Miel Muwn of the Sullustan Constable Brigade.
I'm just a simple starship captain trying to earn a living.
Nice to meet you.
Normally my reports require a full name and genetic record--but I suppose I can acknowledge you as an "unidentified innocent bystander."
I was just passing through when I heard the commotion.
I'm nobody.
You testify your arrival was a coincidence? Interesting.
I don't need to know your name, and I'm not giving mine.
Why would I care?
I see. If you are in some sort of trouble, I might be able to help. I am a law officer, after all.
I have come to Coruscant pursuing a dangerous criminal named Skavak. He is wanted by the government of Sullust for high crimes.
Skavak stole a priceless relic called the Murustavan Ruby. My duty is to arrest him and retrieve it, even if I must act alone.
I'm hunting Skavak, too. He stole my starship.
You're not alone.
Ah! I suspected your timely intervention here was not coincidence, upstanding citizen. This is good news.
Tell me about this priceless relic. Is it... valuable?
Murustavan Ruby?
It is a one-of-a-kind gem as large as your fist, mined from the depths of Sullust millennia ago. We revere it.
Can't you get the Republic to lend a hand?
Don't you have any backup?
Sullust left the Republic after the war. Technically, I have no jurisdiction here. When I requested help from Coruscant's law enforcement, I was denied.
Upstanding citizen, I do not believe your presence here is coincidental. My investigator's instincts tell me you purposely came to this docking bay.
Skavak stole my starship. I came here looking for information.
You're right.
My sympathies on the theft of your ship. I knew I could not be the only one hunting such a notorious lawbreaker.
Interesting theory.
My instincts are rarely wrong, and refusing to agree is not a denial.
I propose we cooperate and share resources. Coruscant is large and... confusing.
If I turn up any useful leads on Skavak's whereabouts, I will contact you. Can I count on you to do the same?
I'll take any help I can get.
Of course.
I am glad to finally have an ally on this world. Together, we will bring that lawbreaker to justice.
I guess.
I suppose that is better than nothing. I will trust you to do what is right.
I don't care about your rock. I want my ship.
No.
There is no reason we cannot both get what we want. I urge you to work with me on this.
Hate to disappoint you, but I just walked in here by mistake.
Sorry, but no.
Oh. Then I am lucky you found me when you did.
Your help with these lawbreakers was invaluable. I will contact the local security forces and file an appropriate report with them.
Keep my name out of that report, all right?
Don't identify me.
Your participation will remain confidential. I will assume full responsibility for what happened here.
You do that.
Based on past experience, local security will not ask many questions. I will continue my search for Skavak soon.
If you need anyone else killed, just call.
Shooting these guys was fun.
I hope that will not be necessary.
Here is your salary allowance as codified by Article 101173 of the Sullustan Emergency Service Laws. Thank you for your brave service.
I will not detain you further, upstanding citizen. Your time and assistance here is greatly appreciated. Good day.
Let us not be here when the local security shows up. We don't have time to answer questions.
Maybe we should go see if Darmas knows anything new about Skavak?
Upstanding citizen? Hello! Over here! Help me!
I did not expect to see you again. Will you free me from this illegal detention facility or not?
I can't risk letting you out just yet.
Maybe later.
Upstanding citizen, wait! I do not understand. Why would you leave me here?
I don't want you getting in my way.
You're a pain in the neck.
You're better off in there, trust me.
It's safer.
I'm doing it for kicks and grins--why else?
Because it's hilarious.
Come back! Please, come back!
If you spot Skavak again, you'd better call me.
Yes, but keep in touch.
Agreed. Next time, I will not attempt to apprehend Skavak without your backup.
Good luck finding your fugitive.
Yes--have fun.
The trail is cold, but Skavak will never escape a member of the Sullustan Constable Brigade!
Normally I would file a Form 7516 and report you leaving me here so long, but I choose to forgive you instead.
Quit jabbering at me and run for it.
Shut up and move.
How noble.
You can stuff your forgiveness.
I couldn't care less.
I must find where the Justicars hid my law enforcement gear and re-arm. With any luck, Skavak has not gotten far....
You're safer in here than you are out there.
Sorry, it's too dangerous.
That does not make any sense! Free me from this prison cell at once!
I just wanted to gloat a little. Enjoy your new home!
I only came for a laugh.
This is an outrage! You are in violation of Statute 87365 of the Sullustan Criminal Code! Do you hear me, lawbreaker?
We don't want to be here when the local security shows. Let's check out that slicer in the Migrant Merchants' Guild.
